dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy. Look at me. Snoopy's not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're after us. We got to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising her voice) He's dying! We can't just leave him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late! He's already gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop yelling at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slaps Suzy in the face. She falls silent. He says slo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I had to do that, but you're panicking. The first rule in any emergency is you never --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy drops the wire-haired terrier which hits the ground a thud. She slaps Sam back with a huge, roundhouse smack. falls over sideways. Suzy stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that again. No one's allowed to slap me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands up and dusts himself off. He and Suzy stare do at the lifeless animal. Suzy says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches into a side-picket of his back-pack and takes an army-shovel. He assembles it. Suzy says hopefully: 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he a good dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Sam shrugs. He says distantly, even cosmically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's to say -- but he didn't deserve to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy slowly wraps her arm around Sam's shoulder. They squ each other tightly. Sam sighs. He begins to dig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp speeds bouncing down a winding dirt road. L Eye, Deluca, and Gadge sit next to him crowded into the passenger seat. Lazy-Eye yells into the hand-set of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stabbed Redford in the back with lefty scissors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice responds over the speaker:

dialogues.speaker: JED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Repeat that, please? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp grabs the hand-set out of Lazy-Eye's hand. shouts into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puncture wound. Lower lumbar. Make room for a stretcher in the cockpit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redford is lying on his stomach on a towel in the rear of vehicle. Scout Master Ward kneels next to him pressing hi hand firmly into the middle of his back. There is signifi blood. Redford moans loudly. Scout Master Ward reassures

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: You're going to be OK. Thank goodness, she missed the artery. Bite on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward puts a pencil in Redford's teeth. Redfo grimaces, crunching it. In the back seat, the rest of the troop excitedly re-cap:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to chop him, but he dodged my tomahawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else got hit? 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. I ran away when the girl went berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got great marksmanship. He shot Deluca in both arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak points to the front seat. Deluca sits glumly in silence. He has numerous small welts all over his arms. G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Snoopy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp's station wagon skids to a stop next to his office while the seaplane pulls up to the dock as Mr. and Mrs. Bishop approach pedalling furiously on bicycles. Mr. Bishop wears boating shoes. Captain Sharp and Scout Maste Ward jump out of the car. Skotak and Gadge help them remo Redford on a stretcher from the back of the station wagon Mr. Bishop struggles with his kick-stand. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: What happened? Who's that? Why's he bleeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the dock, Edgar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp motions for the two old fishermen to get ou the way. He and Scout Master Ward run with the stretcher the dock. Mrs. Bishop is frantic:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Is Suzy with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's in the woods with Shakusky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gadge points toward the hills. A man wearing a jumpsuit a aviator sunglasses stands next to the seaplane. He is Jed shouts as the stretcher approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'm I going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infirmary at Fort Lebanon. We'll be right behind you. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp motions for Skotak, Gadge, and Lazy-eye to Jed load the stretcher into the small cockpit. He tosses set of keys to Scout Master Ward and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm up the motor. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward takes the keys and starts untying the police launch. Captain Sharp heads toward his office. Mr. Bishop says firmly:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Hold it right there. You're not leaving this island. Our daughter's been abducted by one these beige lunatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walt, it's very clear: the two of them conspired in this together.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mr. Bishop. She'll be safe. Sam's got excellent wilderness skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop wheels on Scout Master Ward. He explodes:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Why can't you control your scouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward recoils. He says quietly, troubled:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop takes off his shoe and throws it at Scout Mast Ward. Scout Master Ward ducks, and the shoe bounces off h back. Captain Sharp blocks Mr. Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop scuffles with Captain Sharp. Mrs. Bishop jerks backwards and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Stop it, Walt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop faces Mrs. Bishop and Captain Sharp, breathing heavily. Scout Master Ward looks depressed. Jed, Gadge, Skotak, and Redford watch frozen from a gangplank alongsi the seaplane. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do blame him -- (pointing to Scout Master Ward) -- but I also blame myself and both of you. With all due respect: you can't let your children stab people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: She's violent, Mrs. Bishop. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward shows Mrs. Bishop the blood all over hi hands and uniform. Mrs. Bishop looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Were there witnesses?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Of course. It's assault.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. Are you a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: No, ma'am, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp gently draws Mrs. Bishop away by the should He links arms with her as he tries to placate the group:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy does it. Calm down, Laura.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Stay away from my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop pushes Captain Sharp away from Mrs. Bishop int Scout Master Ward. Scout Master Ward lunges at Mr. Bishop is intercepted by Captain Sharp and Mrs. Bishop. They sho

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN SHARP/MR. BISHOP SCOUT MASTER WARD/MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Dammit! Christ! Shit! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment, a voice interjects from the shore: 49.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Excuse me! Excuse me, Captain Sharp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp, Scout Master Ward, and Mr. and Mrs. Bishop stop fighting and turn around at once. They see: the narrator. He stands at the foot of the dock holding a jou with rubber bands wrapped around it. They all stare at hi blankly. He continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As some of you know, I taught Sam for the cartography Accomplishment Patch. He's a smart boy, and he expressed a keen interest in the history of the island's indigenous peoples. In particular, I recall his fascination with the idea of retracing the original path of the old Chickchaw harvest migration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Everyone looks utterly perplexed. The propell of the seaplane starts up, and they all shield their eyes from the blast of wind and dust. The narrator hesitates. yells over the noise:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm getting at is this: I think I know where they're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrator removes the rubber bands from his journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A carefully hand-drafted nautical chart. A cove is marked with a red arrow and the caption Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The portable record player. Suzy's fingers place the need onto a spinning disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cove enclosed by a low, rocky cliff. It forms an almost complete circle and is overgrown with vines, flowe and branches. A thin channel leads out to the ocean. The on the shore is white, and the water is perfectly clear a crowded with shells at the bottom. Birds echo and fly fro tree to tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's and Suzy's luggage is piled on the beach. The kitte wanders, exploring. The lid of the portable record player open. The voice of Leonard Bernstein says over the speake 50.

dialogues.speaker: RECORD PLAYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Onto the bird-house, where every kind of bird imaginable is whirling and wheeling around. This is a real acrobatic act for our gifted young flute player, Paula Robeson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they listen, Sam and Suzy take off their shoes and soc and run in opposite directions around the edge of the cov They each climb up a rock over the water. They look at ea other across the lagoon. They both laugh. Suzy shouts,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes off his coon-skin cap and throws it aside. Suzy removes her cardigan and drops it on the ground. Sam stri off his uniform down to his white briefs. Suzy take off everything except her underwear and a training bra. They throw their clothes into the water. Sam yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy immediately counts very quickly. They both scream as they leap into the water. They swim toward each other, laughing and shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clothesline hung with Sam's and Suzy's wet clothes sway like flags and snapping in the wind. The tent has been pitched on a low, sandy plateau close to the water. Two l of shells mark a path to the entrance. A long stick is ja into the ground with a flickering safety-candle stuck int the Y at the top. The kitten is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits on a folding stool in front of a portable easel. dips his brush into a tin cup and paints. Suzy poses stretched out and propped up on one arm. She adjusts hers slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here, but I don't like the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, neither. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet. It's got no ring to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's change it. What should it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam continues to paint while Suzy thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A binocular shot of a deep blue, star-filled sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy lies on her back on a flat rock in the middle of the cove looking up into the night. Sam wades out to her and climbs up beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you some jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holds up two dead, shimmering, opalescent beetles wit fish-hooks threaded into their shells. Suzy looks enchant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your ears pierced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the tent, lit by a lantern. Sam clenches his teeth he forces one of the fish-hooks through Suzy's earlobe. S screams murderously. Sam releases her. The beetle dangles neatly. A line of blood runs down the side of Suzy's neck Sam holds up a little mirror. Suzy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty. Do the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam switches to Suzy's other earlobe. She resumes her screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy standing on the beach listening to the Frenc singer's record. They face each other, bobbing their head and tilting awkwardly to the music. Suzy eventually begin dance. Sam does something vaguely like the Twist. They pr against each other and kiss. Suzy says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels hard. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tilt your head sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy kiss again. Sam pushes his hands through Suz hair and draws it back behind her ears. Suzy whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can touch my chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slides his hand up under the training bra and presses onto Suzy's breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to grow more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods. He looks to be in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy sitting on a tree branch over the water eati raisins from Sam's hand. Suzy has flowers in her hair. Sh looks down into the water with her binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always use binoculars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy thinks for minute. She says finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It helps me see things closer. Even if they're not very far away. I pretend it's my magic power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like poetry. Poems don't always have to rhyme, you know. They're just supposed to be creative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy gives Sam the binoculars. He points them at her and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to be? When you grow up. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I want to go on adventures, I think. Not get stuck in one place. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on adventures, too. Not get stuck, too. I guess that sounds almost like I'm just repeating what you just said, but I couldn't think of anything as good as it. On the other hand, maybe we'll get blown up by an atom bomb. You can't predict the exact future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible I may wet the bed, by the way. Later, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I didn't have to mention it, but just in case. I don't want to make you be offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people frown on these problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy nods. She holds Sam's hand. She points to the scorpi brooch pinned to Sam's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that one for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at the brooch. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not an accomplishment. I inherited it from my mother. It's actually not meant for a male to wear -- but I don't give a damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy nods thoughtfully. Pause. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your foster parents still mad at you? For getting in trouble so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. We're getting to know each other better. I feel like I'm in a family now. Not like yours, but similar to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wished I was an orphan. Most of my favorite characters are. I think your lives are more special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam frowns. Tears suddenly well-up in his eyes. He shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, but you don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Suzy says genuinely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire burns in front of the tent. Sam lies on his ba on one of the bedrolls smoking his pipe while Suzy sits Indian-style next to him. She reads aloud from a book cal The Light of Seven Matchsticks. There is an illustration the cover of a child's hand extinguishing a little flame. ribbon of smoke curls between its fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight's beam drew a moon through the black across the attic and settled on a gap in the base-board. A mouse-hole, no bigger than a pocket-watch. Eric crouched on his flat feet and placed his hand in front of the tiny opening. "It's windy," he said. "Like someone in there's blowing on my fingers." Christy rolled her eyes and sighed a sigh. He's right again, she thought. Little brothers drive people crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy looks to Sam to see if he is still awake. Sam nods a signals for Suzy to continue. Suzy turns the page and rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Sam and Suzy are asleep with their arms wrapped around each other inside the tent. They wear only their underwear. The sound of an airplane approaches. Sam eyes open. The noise buzzes by loudly overhead. Suzy sits Sam scrambles to his feet, unzips the flaps of the tent, looks out. Suzy crouches beside him, holding onto his leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp standing on the beach fifteen feet away. Sc Master Ward waits behind him with Gadge, Skotak, and Lazy Eye. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop stride up out of the water. Mr. Bishop looks incensed. They are wet to the waist. The pol launch is moored in the lagoon. Two larger boats with St. Jack Wood Fire Brigade printed on their hulls float furth away. Men in red caps stand on their decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy pulls Sam back inside. She zips up the tent again. S kisses Sam. Mr. Bishop hollers:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Suzy! Get out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop grabs hold of the entire tent by the top and r it up out of the ground, uprooting the stakes which go flying. This reveals:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy, half-naked, entwined, kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Bishop both freeze. Sam and Suzy look up to them. Mr. Bishop growls and roars at them ferociously lik monster. Sam and Suzy look horrified. Mr. Bishop's face suddenly drains of all emotion. Pause. Mrs. Bishop comman Sam and Suzy:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Put your clothes on. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy remain perfectly still. Mrs. Bishop grabs Su by the arm and jerks her to her feet. Sam and Suzy hang o each other. Mrs. Bishop slaps Suzy with a whack. Sam lets and Suzy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward comes over to Sam sadly and hands him h uniform. Sam takes it. Scout Master Ward turns to the oth scouts, claps his hands twice, and says: 56.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Strike this camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts putting on his socks. Captain Sharp watches hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp drives his boat along the coast with a grim look on his face. Suzy rides in the back with Mr. and Mrs Bishop. Sam rides in the front with the other scouts. An interrogation is in progress:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you planning to stay there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said ten days or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you ever think about what would happen next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to my recollection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a traitor to our family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward sits next to Captain Sharp. He shows hi the air-mail envelope.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: What do I do about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp shrugs. He says, resigned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him his mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward turns to Sam. He holds out the envelope Sam takes it. He opens it. He reads. Suzy watches him fro across the boat. She calls out anxiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say? 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't invite me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave them too much aggravation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy stands up. She says as she starts across the boat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holds out the note. Mr. Bishop pulls Suzy back down t her seat. He stands up, himself, and walks over to Sam. H takes him by the wrist and leads him to a small cabin. He opens the door and presses him forward. Sam stumbles down steps and looks back. Mr. Bishop shuts the door. Captain Sharp glares at him. Suzy says icily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's child abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop returns to the back of the boat and sits down again. He gives Suzy a direct order:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Be advised: the two of you will never see each other again. Those were your last words. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be careful if I were you. One of these days somebody's going to be pushed too far, and who knows what they're capable of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a threat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy looks from Captain Sharp to Mrs. Bishop and back to Bishop. Mr. Bishop falls silent. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew what makes you tick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Please, terminate this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's saying that to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel shakes his head bitterly. Suzy stares out to sea. Scout Master Ward walks over to the cabin, opens the door and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room with two bunks, two portholes, and a pile of ropes. Sam sits hunched over with his hands in his lap. H stares at the envelope. Scout Master Ward sits down acros from him. He motions to the envelope and says quietly, pausing between each sentence:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about this. I didn't know your situation. It's not on the register. How'd you lose your parents? I shouldn't ask that. Never mind. I wish we had time for an inspection back there. On the beach. I would've given you a "commendable". That was one of the best- pitched camp-sites I've ever seen. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam does not respond. Scout Master Ward asks in a wounded

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: You don't want to be a Khaki Scout anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky sits at the switchboard with her head-phones on. Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward sit behind her wearin their own sets of head-phones. There is a click on the ot end of the line. 59.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, I have your person-to-person from New Penzance.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, New Penzance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split-screen. On one side of the frame, we see Captain Sh Scout Master Ward, and Becky. On the other side, we see a fifty-year-old woman in a blue and white uniform pants-su with a Salvation Army officer-style hat and a red ribbon in a bow around her neck. She is Social Services. She sit a desk in a cinder block office. Guards and orderlies cri cross in a bullet-proof window to a long, grey corridor behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? This is Captain Sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services flips open a file-folder and picks up a b point pen. (She takes notes throughout the conversation.) says into her telephone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Captain Sharp. This is Social Services. I'm calling in reference to Sam Shakusky, Ward of the State. I understand he's in your custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his condition? Has he suffered any injury or trauma of any kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. How do I get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fastest way is by seaplane. Jed can bring you in with the mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come tomorrow morning, if that's acceptable to you. Is someone able to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOCIAL SERVICES (cont'd) provide reasonable care and nourishment for the boy until that time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. I'll contact you again before the end of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services starts to hang up the telephone. Captain Sharp says abruptly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Social Services puts down her pen. She clasps her hands together in front of her. She says finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, normally, we'd try to place him in another foster home, but that option is no longer available to us, in my opinion, with his case history -- which means he'll go to Juvenile Refuge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp exchanges a look with Scout Master Ward. Sc Master Ward interjects:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: What's that? An orphanage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services frowns. She asks calmly: 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's speaking?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: This is Scout Master Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services refers to a document in her file-folder. nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. An orphanage -- but the first step is the admissions panel requires a psychological evaluation to determine whether or not the boy's a candidate for institutional treatment or electroshock therapy. Beyond that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Shock therapy? Why would that be necessary? He's not violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services picks up the document. She points to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The report describes an assault with scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the girl! Who did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe she needs help, too -- but that's not our job. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Service hangs up the telephone. Becky pulls the co out of their sockets. Scout Master Ward looks to Captain Sharp. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky opens a tin of home-made lemon bars. Captain Sharp declines one. Scout Master Ward tries one. He looks completely enchanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room. There is a wicker rocking chair, a vase filled with wilted wildflowers, and a portrait of some 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrims hanging over a stone fireplace. Lionel, Murray, Rudy sit together on the floor playing Parchesi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop lurches into the doorway, shirtless. He carrie open bottle of red wine with a glass in one hand and a lo handled woodsman's axe in the other.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'll be out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel, Murray, and Lionel look up from their game. Mr. Bishop hesitates. He seems slightly disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm going to find a tree to chop down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop exits. Pause. Lionel rolls a pair of dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old linoleum floor. Dark curtainless window. One bare lig bulb. Suzy sits erect in the bathtub staring blankly into space. Mrs. Bishop washes her with a soapy sponge. Suzy's clothes and leather folder are in the corner with the kit scratching at them.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I do know what you're feeling, Suzy-bean. I've had moments myself where I say: what am I doing here? Who made this decision? How could I allow myself to do something so stupid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and why is it still happening? We women are more emotional. You have to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy turns to Mrs. Bishop and interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say "hate".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: You think you mean it. In this moment. You're trying to hurt me. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you do with that sad, dumb police man. You go to bed with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop looks stunned. She says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: He's not dumb, but I guess he is kind of sad. Anyway, we shouldn't discuss that. It's not appropriate for me to even acknowledge what I already just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop sees something sticking out of the leather folder. She pulls it out and stares at it. It is the "Cop with the Very Troubled Child" pamphlet. She looks to Suzy Suzy looks away. Mrs. Bishop sighs deeply and says, on th verge of tears:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Poor Suzy. Why is everything so hard for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy starts to cry. She covers her face. Her voice breaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in love. We just want to be together. What's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop puts her arms around Suzy. Suzy shakes, silen sobbing. Mrs. Bishop pulls some twigs and stems out of Su hair. She studies the beetle earrings. She says wearily:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. How are we going to get these fish-hooks out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp cooks sausages on a skillet in a kitchenett He has a bottle of beer in his hand. Sam sits waiting at fold-out table with a glass of milk in front of him. He s without looking up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit we knew we'd get in trouble. That part's true. We knew people would be worried, and we still ran away, anyway -- but something also happened which we didn't do on purpose. When we first met each other. Something happened to us. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp stirs the sausages in the pan. He nods. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree with you. That's eloquent. I can't argue against anything you're saying -- but I don't have to, because you're twelve years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp brings the skillet to the table and serves three links onto one plate and three onto another. He sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's face it, you're probably a much more intelligent person than I am. In fact, I guarantee it -- but even smart kids sometimes stick their fingers in electrical sockets, if you see what I mean. It takes time to figure things out. It's been proven by history: all mankind makes mistakes. It's our job to try to protect you from the dangerous ones. If we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp pours an inch of beer into a glass and slid it over to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a slug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods. He and Captain Sharp both drink sips. Captain S asks gently and sincerely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush? You've got your whole life in front of yourself. Ahead of you, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe so. Anyway, you're a bachelor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with it? So are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. Did you love someone ever? 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't love me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam considers this. Captain Sharp looks depressed. They s eating their sausages. Captain Sharp says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for your loss. Anyway, that's what people say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk truck driver smashed into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Captain Sharp refills both their beer glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward sits on his cot in his pajamas again wi cigarette in his mouth. His tape recorder is recording. H says into the microphone:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Scout Master's Log. September fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward hesitates. He thinks for a minute. He t a deep breath. He closes his eyes. He opens them again. H looks desperate. He looks up at the ceiling. He shakes hi head. He presses stop. He kneels on the floor with his pa together and smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a slight commotion outside. Scout Master Ward

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Stow it, out there! I want to hear some Z's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fort sixty feet above the camp. It is still under construction. The entire troop (with the exceptions of Redford and Sam) has gathered for a clandestine meeting. all wear pajamas. Skotak stands on a balcony with his bac the group and his hands on a wooden railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he's going to reform school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard they're going to take out a piece of his brain and send him to an insane asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like his girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too scruffy for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposedly, they got to third base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. He just felt her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over-shirt or under-shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak slams his fist on the railing. Everyone looks startled. Skotak turns around to face the group. He says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The railing collapses behind Skotak, ripping part of a wa and a row of shingles off the structure as it falls away. There is a moment of silence before it hits the ground wi splintering thud. Skotak hesitates. He moves a half-step from the edge. He continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This troop has been very shabby to Field Mate Sam Shakusky. In fact, we've been a bunch of mean jerks. Why's he so unpopular? I admit, supposedly, he's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emotionally disturbed -- but he's also a disadvantaged orphan. How would you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak moves among the group, looking from face to face,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nickleby? Deluca? Lazy-Eye? (from the heart) Gadge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak circles around the edge of the tree house. He says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fellow Khaki Scout, and he needs our help. Are we man enough to give that? So part of his brain doesn't get removed out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak stands still. He says mysteriously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were prepared to die for each other out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The other scouts begin to murmur to each other, shaking their heads, shrugging, whispering, and gesturing Finally, Deluca looks up to Skotak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters? Three yards of chicken wire, some ripped-up newspapers, and a bucket of wheatpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick tree has been chopped almost completely through i trunk. For some reason, it remains standing. Mr. Bishop s on the ground leaning against it. He breathes heavily. Th axe rests across his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twig snaps. Mr. Bishop looks up, listening. Pause. He drinks a sip of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, on the other side of the lawn, five sm silhouettes run silently in a row away from the house int the trees on the left. A moment later, one taller silhoue rides a bicycle silently away from the house into the tre on the right. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp sits on the hood of his station wagon. Mrs. Bishop leans against it with her bicycle in front of her. They smoke cigarettes. Captain Sharp says sadly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, it's over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I guess so. For the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until further notice.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I've got to do better. For everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Except you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you can. I think you will. You're doing the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Captain Sharp suddenly slides his hand inside Mrs. Bishop's shirt onto her breast and simultaneously kisses -- then just as suddenly gets into his car and starts the engine. Mrs. Bishop hesitates. She reaches inside the win and puts her hand on the top of Captain Sharp's head. She says, worried:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Who know what's going to happen, Duffy? I'll probably see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The motor idles. Captain Sharp says distantly: 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire them, you know? There's a purity to it. I only feel bad because they both seem like such unhappy, lonely, miserable people -- but maybe that's romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp puts the car into gear and drives off. Mrs. Bishop finishes her cigarette. She gets on her bicycle an rides away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burning match drops down into the fireplace near the fo of a bunk where Sam lies sleeping. He has the sheet pulle to his chin, but his toes stick out. He opens one eye. Du descends and settles. Something scrapes and scratches. Th flame burns out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slides slowly off the mattress and creeps across the floor. He crouches in front of the fireplace. He flicks o scout flashlight and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of a hanging rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans quickly into the fireplace and looks straight u shining his flashlight. Skotak is looking down at him fro the top of the chimney. He puts his finger to his lips. S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. We're here for friendship. We're going to get you off this island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks. This is an emergency rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worthless to me. There's no point. Not without Suzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak gestures for Sam to wait. He disappears from view. moment later, Suzy's face appears at the top of the chimn smiling toothily. Sam looks ecstatic. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They snuck me down the laundry chute and left a paper-machГ© dummy in my bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diversion tactics. Good thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next room. Captain Sharp sleeps in boxer shorts on th floor of the kitchenette in the dark. He snores quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five mini-canoes race across a wide, choppy strait close the open sea. Skotak, Deluca, Nickleby, Gadge, Lazy-Eye, Panagle, Roosevelt, Chef, and Izod paddle aggressively. W hear in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: SKOTAK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fort Lebanon. My cousin Ben runs the Supply and Resources outpost for the Jubilee. He's a Falcon Scout, Legionnaire. Cousin Ben'll know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can we trust him?

dialogues.speaker: SKOTAK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Normally, I'd say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy ride in the back of the canoe that Skotak ro Sam has his arms around Suzy's waist. The kitten is on he shoulder. Sam sees the portable record player among Suzy' things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you leave another note for Lionel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time. He can't keep his trap shut. Besides, I'll probably never see him again. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pebble beach below high dunes. Large waves sweep into t shore. Spray blows through the air. There is a black lighthouse on a rocky point in the distance. The narrator stands at the water's edge holding a meteorologist's measuring stick. He braces himself against the gusting wi He speaks to the camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the island of St. Jack Wood, extending far north from Land's End along the deep-water channel that leads to Broken Rock. A low flood-plain separates the beach from the town-ship above. A small but prosperous community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrator takes out a pocket barometer. He reads it. H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barometer reads twenty-seven inches and dropping. Strong winds, as you can see, already at twenty-two knots. (checks his watch) The time is now four thirty-five A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrator walks quickly out of the shot. The five cano land on the beach with the tide. Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and t rest of the troop quickly jump out and drag the boats up shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is black. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop lie in separate si beds side-by-side. They both stare at the ceiling. The windows rattle, the walls creak, and trees sway outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Mrs. Bishop whispers:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Did you file the motion for continuance? Peabody vs. Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: It was sustained.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Good. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the judge consider your application for leniency? Rogers vs. Yentob.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: He granted it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Mrs. Bishop's voice breaks as she says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Walt.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Which injuries are you apologizing for? Specifically.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Specifically? Whichever ones still hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half of those were self-inflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop shakes her head and smiles with tears on her face. A powerful blast of wind shakes the room. A night-l blinks. Mr. Bishop has a lump in his throat as he says:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I hope the roof flies off, and I get sucked up into space. You'll be better off without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop feeling sorry for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Bishop look across at each other in the dark Mrs. Bishop says desperately:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: We're all they've got, Walt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop takes a deep breath. He says finally, with a

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlight and lantern flames flicker over the jagged wal Skotak is curled in a blanket on a high rock. Gadge is tu into a sleeping bag under a ledge. The troop nestle on ro and ledges in bedrolls and sleeping bags all around the d cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lies on his back on one of the bedrolls smoking his p while Suzy sits Indian-style next to him. She reads aloud from a book called Annabelle's Midnight. There is an illustration on the cover of a blonde girl climbing out a window onto a trellis with fireflies circling around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- but I'm not going," said Barnaby Jack. "I'm running away tonight for good, and this time I won't get caught." Annabelle whispered: "I'm coming with you." Her yellow hair, now brown at the roots, caught up in the wind and danced. Barnaby Jack took Annabelle's hand and pressed something into it the size of a jellybean. "Hide this in your socks, and be ready at midnight."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy looks to Sam to see if he is still awake. Sam looks the rest of the troop to see if they are still awake. The all nod and signal for Suzy to continue. Suzy turns the p and reads on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leapt out the window and landed in the fresh-fallen snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Camp Ivanhoe. Scout Master Ward emerges from his tent. He puts on his hat. The wind whips it off head. He chases it, catches it, and puts it back on with chin-strap tight. He frowns. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: No bugle? No reveille? Lazy-eye, Gadge, Deluca, Izod? Where's my troop? Let's go! You're late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward tries to light a cigarette, but the mat blows out. He walks past the latrine, the workbench, the of smaller tents, and the charcoal grill. He throws his h into the air. 74.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Chef? Breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward shakes his head. He arrives at the picn table and rings his bell. He sits down. He opens a new is of Indian Corn. There is a picture on the cover of a scou troop rappelling in Tasmania. He struggles to keep the rippling pages from turning by themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first page. There is another drawing of the Scout Mas in-Chief. This time he is behind the wheel of a ship. His signature below, once again, reads Commander Pierce. Ther a quotation in large text: "Anyone can hold the helm when sea is calm."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Scout Master Ward lowers his magazine. He looks around, confused. Something dawns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small entourage of teenage scouts studies maps, charts, documents at folding tables. One of them sits at a telegr machine. He wears headphones and taps Morse code on a pad as he listens to a transmission. He looks puzzled. He swi his chair to a steno-machine and begins typing rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A triple-sized tent with a canopy in front and a large to pole looming over it. It stands on five-foot stilts. Ther a school bus parked next to it with letters painted acros its side which read Regional Jubilee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forty-five-year-old scout master with several medals on chest is sharpening a straight razor. He is Secretary McIntire. He adjusts a hot towel on the face of a man in barber's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young telegraph operator hurries out of the tent carr a strip of paper. He hands it to Secretary McIntire. Secretary McIntire stares at it. He says to the man under

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to believe this one, sir. That Scout Master on New Penzance? Has now lost his entire troop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seated man whips the towel off his face and rises to feet. He is Commander Pierce himself. He has silver hair, moustache, and a much greater number of medals. He says i disbelief as he snatches the slip of paper: 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be damned. Who is this bimbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce shakes his head. He continues to study t document as he sits back down. Secretary McIntire begins lather his cheeks with a brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast archway of wood, straw, and rope construction. For Lebanon is spelled out across the top with bound sticks. large flag waving madly on a pole reads Khaki Scouts of N America. A bugler on a platform plays the familiar stacca tattoo. It echoes for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy wait inside the gates crouched behind a row trash cans with the rest of the troop except Skotak. They shiver. Sam has on his back-pack. Suzy carries her suitca Gadge holds a tennis ball can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scout master in an Indian chief's headdress stops as he walks by. He looks curiously at Sam and especially Suzy. says to Nickleby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your unit leader?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Nickleby points to a fat man in an apron cooking hamburgers on a grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scout master shrugs. Skotak comes over and says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a broken gum-ball machine behind the snack tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak distributes a handful of gum-balls among Sam, Suzy and the rest of the troop. They all put them in their mou Skotak motions for everyone to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A footbridge across a stream leads to a Quonset hut with awning in front labelled Supply Tent. A crowd of very you scouts waits at a wide counter bartering over boxes of fo drink, and equipment. A team of helpers collects money an packages goods. At the center, there is a twenty-year-old 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scout with a pencil behind his ear. He is Cousin Ben. He to a nine-year-old Junior Khaki:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care how they do it where you come from. You want pop? You want candy? You want a snake-bite kit? Get some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak appears and whispers something to Cousin Ben. Cous Ben nods. He says to his customers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben pulls a curtain shut behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Suzy, Skotak and the rest of the troop follow Cousin briskly out a door and onto a cat-walk that runs along th top of a wall made from tall, pointed logs. As they talk, they walk past dozens of rows and clusters of tents group by color in the fields below. They walk past towers, huts ladders, latrines, and a catapult under construction. The walk past a white infirmary with a red cross on it and a doctor taking a boy's blood pressure. They walk past a fl of small, antique sailboats flying assorted troop banners Five hundred scouts and fifty scout masters work, eat, ta cook, and play sports and games all around the compound i spite of the fierce winds. One group rides motorcycles, another fires model rockets, another flies by overhead on cable-trolley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben points to Sam and asks Skotak over the sound o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Field Mate Sam Shakusky, Troop 55, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hot. Almost too hot. What's in the can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-six dollars -- but it's mostly in nickels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak motions for Gadge to hand Cousin Ben the tennis ba can. It appears to be very heavy and jingles as it moves. Cousin Ben takes it. He says to Sam:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You badge in seamanship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam points to one of the patches on his sash. It has an anchor embroidered on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. There's cold-water crabber moored off Broken Rock. The skipper owes me an I.O.U. We'll see if he can take you on as a claw cracker. It won't be an easy life, but it's better than shock therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. By the way, where's the chapel tent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben hesitates. He points behind them with his thum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back there, but the padre's home with the mumps. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to bring my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben stops walking. He looks Sam up and down. Suzy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're not married yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben turns to Suzy. He looks back to Sam and back t Suzy again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You his girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy nods. Cousin Ben looks intrigued. He says tentativel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, I'm a civil-law scrivener. I'm authorized to declare births, deaths, and marriages. You're kind of young. You got a license? 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy shake their heads. Cousin Ben nods. He speak more gently now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't offer you a legally binding union. It won't hold up in the state, the county, or, frankly, any courtroom in the world due to your age, lack of a license, and failure to get parental consent -- but the ritual does carry a very important moral weight within yourselves. You can't enter into this lightly. Do you love each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy immediately nod. Cousin Ben continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy immediately nod. Cousin Ben looks perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me rephrase it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit out the gum, sister. In fact, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben puts out his hand. Suzy spits her gum into his palm. He throws it away over his shoulder. Sam and the re of the troop spit their gum out on the ground. Cousin Ben

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the snappy attitude. This is the most important decision you've made in your lives. Now go over by that trampoline and talk it through before you give me another quick answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben watches as Sam and Suzy walk away and stand ne to a large trampoline. A small scout jumps from a high ladder, bounces, and does a back-flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy uncertain how to begin the conversation. Sam shrugs. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we better try to pretend we're struggling over our decision for a minute before we go back over there and tell him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's right. It could be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks stunned. He is speechless. He stammers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being married. Sometimes it seems sad to me. It might be better to just go steady permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head. He looks off into the distance. He s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben counting nickels in the tennis ball can. He je his thumb toward Sam and Suzy and says dismissively:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they're probably just trying to pretend they're struggling over their decision, but at least --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben looks. Suzy has her hands around Sam's throat is throttling him. Sam squirms loose and calms her down. troop watches transfixed. Sam takes a snapshot out of his pocket and shows it to Suzy, explaining. Suzy nods. They back over to the group. There are tears on Suzy's cheeks. says to Cousin Ben:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's do a blood test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben stands at a collapsible altar. He wears a purp silk stole around his neck with crosses stitched into it. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Suzy hold a Bible with their hands on it. Skotak and rest of troop listen solemnly as Cousin Ben reads from a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- which we hereby consecrate on this day, the fifth of September, 1965.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the end of the short-form. Do any of the witnesses have objections or remarks? Usually, they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak raises his hand. Cousin Ben reluctantly calls on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we loan them the nickels? I'm worried about their future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak and the rest of the troop look very concerned. The murmur to each other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in favor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak and the rest of the troop look to Cousin Ben. Cous Ben glares at them. He sighs. He points to Skotak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just like your brothers. OK, give them the tennis ball can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben points to the tennis ball can on the floor nex his feet. Skotak takes it and zips it into a side-pocket 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's back-pack. Cousin Ben hands Sam and Suzy a receipt clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here -- and initial here and here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy sign and initial. Cousin Ben tears out a cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the carbon. Leave the Bible. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy turn and walk out of the chapel tent holding hands. They do not smile. Cousin Ben, Skotak, and the res the troop follow them with grave expressions on their fac Sam touches Suzy's hair. Suzy kisses Sam's hand. They wal a group through the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop wait at the of a narrow dock. Cousin Ben stands below them in a small sailboat. He reaches up to Suzy and lifts her onboard. He reaches up to Sam and lifts him onboard, too. He rigs the sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiles sadly. He and Skotak do the secret handshake. others quickly join in. Suzy blows them a kiss. Everyone looks choked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben unloops a line. The sails quickly catch the st wind, and the boat sails away into the harbor. Skotak and rest of troop wave and salute. They watch, bittersweet. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they going again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to work on a shrimper, if I understand correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish them well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak sighs. He turns and starts up the dock. The others follow him. Roosevelt hesitates. He points. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak and the rest of the troop stop and turn around. Th sailboat glides back in. Sam leaps onto the dock with the tennis ball can. Suzy looks worried. Cousin Ben yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quick, sailor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left her binoculars on a hook in the chapel tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sprints up the dock. He yells back over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't. It's her magic power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A binocular shot of Sam running full-speed through the compound. He approaches quickly -- then skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redford blocks the entrance. He is dressed in white hospi pajamas with a red cross on the breast pocket. His side i heavily bandaged and his arm is attached to an I/V drip. lowers Suzy's binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands frozen in front of Redford. Redford stares at icily. Sam starts to say something -- then pauses. He say

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed your dog, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoopy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it couldn't be helped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods. He asks quietly: 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you consider me your enemy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redford frowns. He says in disbelief:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because your girlfriend stabbed me in the back with lefty scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my wife now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying before that. Six weeks ago. From day one. What'd I do wrong? I'm trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I? Nobody else does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs up to Redford and pokes him as hard as he can in scissor cut with his finger. Redford screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scouts and scout masters everywhere stop what they are do and look to the chapel tent. Across the compound, Command Pierce comes out of his tent, alerted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam whips the binoculars out of Redford's hands, turns aw and sprints. No one moves anywhere except Sam dashing tow the marina. Redford shouts at the top of his lungs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here! The fugitive! Stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An emergency alarm sounds. The entire camp swings into action. Two teams of scouts playing capture-the-flag desc from both sides and cut Sam off from the dock. They wear and yellow jerseys over their uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy jumps out of the boat onto the dock. Sam sees her be the blockade of scouts. She waves her arms. Sam throws up hands. He sprints in a new direction, onto a wide field. There is a small, pink flag on a thin stick stuck in the ground at the center of a plastic ring. Sam grabs it as h runs past. He looks back and sees: 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mob of fifty scouts chasing him. He circles in a giant figure eight trailed by the huge group. He races up a hil and stops at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks down at the approaching scouts and hundreds of others watching. A dark cloud rolls in casting a giant sh over the entire camp. Sam throws the little flag down at pursuers like a javelin. It sails in an arc and pokes dow into the grass. There is a thunderclap. Sam looks up into sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bolt of lightning strikes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is thrown ten feet through the air and lands on his b The tennis ball can explodes nickels. The mob of scouts s with a jolt. They look terrified. Sam sits up. He is cove in black soot. His shoes are on fire. He shakes them off feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy runs through the crowd of scouts and drops down on h knees in front of Sam. She looks astonished. Sam says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy helps Sam to his feet. Sam raises Suzy's smoldering binoculars to his eyes. Skotak and the rest of the troop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A binocular shot of a ladder leaning against a high fence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leads Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop fly at sprint to the fence, climb the ladder, and pull it up aft them. A bugle plays a cavalry charge. The mob bolts after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split-screen. On one side of the frame, we see Captain Sh Scout Master Ward, and Becky wearing their operator head- phones. On the other side, we see Commander Pierce, Secre McIntire, and the commander's entourage inside the comman tent. Commander Pierce says into his field-telephone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp, we've located the missing troop. They just fled camp. We're in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMMANDER PIERCE (cont'd) pursuit. They're accompanied by a twelve- year-old girl in knee-socks and Sunday- school shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, Commander Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp spins around in his chair and flips a switc a two-way radio. He says into a microphone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jed, re-route to St. Jack Wood. Tell Social Services the boy's been spotted at Fort Lebanon.

dialogues.speaker: JED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. Will comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp sets down the microphone. He turns to Becky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky, notify the Bishops: Suzy's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky nods. Captain Sharp turns to Scout Master Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy? You monitoring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward is already on his feet. He peels off hi head-phones.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Affirmative. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky plugs a cord into a socket and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Mr. Bishop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp looks out the window with a sense of dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop listens on the telephone with a strained look his face. Mrs. Bishop watches him intently.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop grabs Mrs. Bishop by the wrist. He says grimly

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Get the boys. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop raises her megaphone to her mouth. She shouts

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Let's go! Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deHavilland Beaver in heavy rain and turbulence. Jed sp into his radio while piloting the aircraft. Social Servic sits beside him in the passenger's seat. She looks queasy determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower control, this is Jed. Confirm co- ordinates for new destination: alpha-two- two-seven-one-fiver. Looking pretty soupy up here. Wouldn't mind setting down before the pot boils over. (to Social Services) Hang on, Social Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jed presses the yoke forward, and the plane dips hard. So Services braces against the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward steers his outboard through the open channel. The boat crests high over deep swells, flooding in waves. Scout Master Ward is drenched. He does not flin or even appear to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop scramble thr the woods as fast as they can. There are flashes of light and pounding thunder. Suzy trips on a root, and Sam pulls to her feet. Sam trips on a rock, and Suzy pulls him to h feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commander's entourage is frantically packing up their portable telephones, P.A. system, folding tables, collaps chairs, etc. One of them wraps a tarp around boxes labell Fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transistor radio. The announcer says urgently:

dialogues.speaker: WEATHER MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once again: storm waters have just breached the dam at Black Beacon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEATHER MAN (V.O.) (cont'd) Reservoir. A flash flood alert is in effect. Take immediate precautions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce and Secretary McIntire listen to the rep Secretary McIntire says gravely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's coming our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pierce nods, worried. The capture-the-flag scouts soaking jerseys gather, winded, outside the tent. One of team captains stands in the entrance breathing heavily. Commander Pierce points to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the entourage) Prepare to mobilize to higher ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire hands Commander Pierce an envelope wit red-and-white stripes on it. Commander Pierce rips it ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Jack Church is the designated storm shelter. (to Secretary McIntire) Notify all scouts to muster outside my tent on the double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The St. Jack's Church poster box. Another mimeographed pa is stapled to the bulletin board. The heading is now Summ Pageant, 1965. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Performed by the Choristers of St. Jack Wood and New Penzance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set for the ark stands on the platform behind the alt There are candles and garlands in place, but also stacks 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cardboard boxes and gallons of distilled-water. Numerous animal costumes hang from a rolling garment rack. An old crosses the aisle carrying a large, metal coffee dispense Two young priests cross in the opposite direction carryin folding cots. Voices shout urgently off-screen:

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: More sandbags! We need dry blankets! Wake up the Deacon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop slowly poke their heads in from the side door and creep up the stairs the choir loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire brigade of scouts stands assembled in formatio the rain. The last two stragglers come running and hurry their positions. They all wear rain slickers or canvas ponchos. Commander Pierce, Secretary McIntire, and the commander's entourage emerge quickly from the command ten Commander Pierce shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, company! Prepare for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce hesitates. He points down to the marina says to Secretary McIntire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire and the commander's entourage turn to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward speeding toward the dock in his motorbo He leaps to shore, throws a line over a post, and sprints to the assembly. He salutes Commander Pierce. Commander Pierce frowns and asks with quiet ferocity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yourself a Khaki Scout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your goddamn troop? They could get killed out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have them? 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a liability to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The incident may affect our insurance premiums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce looks at Scout Master Ward's breast pock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name-tag that reads Scout Master Ward next to a patch w a picture of a snow-capped mountain. It says K.S.N.A. Leadership underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce says bitterly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm field-stripping you of your command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce rips the patch off Scout Master Ward's uniform and throws it aside. He holds out his hand, palm Scout Master Ward looks stricken. He reaches into his poc takes out his scout pocket-knife, and hands it Commander Pierce. Commander Pierce puts it into his own pocket. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, company! Prepare for emergency evacuation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire leans close to Commander Pierce. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, do you have your medicine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce hesitates. He holds up a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
