dialogues.text: Commander Pierce strides back into the command tent. Secretary McIntire looks to Scout Master Ward, uneasy. Sc Master Ward stares down at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flash-flood explodes out from the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gushing water pours down the hillside, cuts a swath throu the center of the camp, and tears down everything in its narrow path. The command tent suddenly becomes a tiny isl at the center of a rushing river. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company is taken aback. Scout Master Ward stiffens, watchful. The totem pole creaks and sways, then falls cle onto the command tent, splitting it down the middle. Insi something sparks, pops, then blows up. The tent bursts in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire does not react. He stands perfectly st watching the fire. Scout Master Ward taps him, grabs him, shakes him. Secretary McIntire looks at him blankly. Scou Master Ward makes a snap decision. He turns to the compan

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Hold your position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward runs ahead, splashes into the raging fl wades through it against the current, dodging branches an debris, then pulls himself up onto the fallen totem pole walks balancing on it to the burning tent. He disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire and the vast company watch, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward comes out the opposite side of the tent onto the other end of the fallen totem pole carrying Commander Pierce over his shoulders. He descends back int the water, trudges through it, and steps up onto the embankment. The company looks deeply, permanently impress Scout Master Ward hollers:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Company Secretary! Status report, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire hesitates. He stirs to attention and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All accounted for, Scout Master!

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Supply and Resources! Call it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ben gives an A-OK sign near the front of the assem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative, sir!

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Fall in! We're going to run for it, boys! Let's move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire company follows Scout Master Ward with Command Pierce over his shoulders at a fast jog out of the camp. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has now been converted into a full-fledged refug center. Families from the town-ship huddle in pews with b and piles of their wet belongings. Priests and nuns distribute towels and sandwiches to frightened children. and cats prowl nervously. Sandbags are stacked in low wal outside the doors and windows. The rain beats on the roof and lightning continues to flash through the stained glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A side door opens. Captain Sharp comes in from the storm Mr. and Mrs. Bishop. Lionel, Murray, Rudy, and the two ol fishermen follow closely behind them. They slam the door. Captain Sharp looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another side door opens. Scout Master Ward jogs in with Commander Pierce still over his shoulders and the entire company behind him flooding into the room. Captain Sharp yells to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward goes over to Captain Sharp and turns hi back to him, jogging in place.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Take the commander off of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp helps Commander Pierce down off Scout Maste Ward's back and into a pew to rest. Secretary McIntire assists them. Mr. Bishop strides up the aisle yelling to left and right:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Suzy? Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) They ran away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Bishop grimace, unbelievably frustrated. Sco Master Ward addresses the scouts:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: We're going back out. I need volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands raise. Scout Master Ward passes out walkie-talkies he chooses his squad: 92.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: You, you, you, you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky steps in front of Scout Master Ward with her hand raised. Scout Master Ward hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: -- and you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky takes a walkie-talkie. She looks at Scout Master Wa with admiration and asks, concerned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I am. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward leads Becky by the arm through the crow church as they begin to gather supplies: extra flashlight flare gun, coils of rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp looks up to the choir loft. Eleven children dressed in animal masks sit quietly in a row. Captain Sha does a double-take. One of the animals is an otter wearin Sunday-school shoes and binoculars around its neck. Next her is the male of the species in a sash with numerous sm embroidered patches on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front doors open. There is lightning, thunder, wind, rain. Social Services enters. She takes off a wet cape wi red lining and hands it to an acolyte in a robe. Jed pres the doors shut behind them. Social Services asks immediat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp hesitates. He says reluctantly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be irritated) What do you want me to say, lady? (to no one in particular) Somebody get Jed a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acolyte runs to the coffee dispenser with a cardboard cup. Social Services charges over to Captain Sharp. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Captain Sharp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Social Services. I remanded the boy to your personal custody. You're responsible for his safety. I'm told he was just struck by lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp frowns. He looks to Scout Master Ward and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first I heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp tries to process this. Social Services now moves in on Scout Master Ward. She says aggressively:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward, I presume?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your reputation precedes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward stand side-by-side in front of Social Services. She berates them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are the most appallingly incompetent custodial guardians Social Services has ever had the misfortune to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in a twenty-seven year career!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward look sheepish. Social Services says bitterly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have to say for yourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp hesitates. He says strangely: 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this. They'll eat him alive in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to Scout Master Ward) What's the name of the place again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juvenile refuge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juvenile refuge. That sounds like jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. In the background, the acolyte picks up Panagle' walking stick weapon off the floor. He stares at it, puzz Social Services says carefully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just find the boy -- and deliver him -- (motioning to herself) -- to Social Services. Nothing else is in your power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services, Captain Sharp, and Scout Master Ward tur Mr. and Mrs. Bishop. Mr. Bishop looks tense.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: Can we get back to the rescue now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Walt and Laura Bishop. Their daughter's the missing girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parents of the stabber? 95.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: I object to that description. She was attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Pierce appears with an oxygen mask over his fac He pulls it aside briefly and says to Secretary McIntire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the details. Where's the scout she knifed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire snaps his fingers and gives a signal. Redford appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Field Mate Redford, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the oxygen mask) What's his condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may suffer some limited chronic kidney insufficiency. Here's the report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretary McIntire hands Commander Pierce a doctor's repo Mrs. Bishop snatches it and throws it over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this!

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: She's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services turns and starts up the aisle. She stops suddenly. Captain Sharp is standing in their path brandis Panagle's walking stick weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops. Captain Sharp locks eyes with Social Services. He says in a steely voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not getting shock therapy. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services looks furious. Her jaw sets. She reaches inside her jacket and withdraws a small pad labelled Cita Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! I'm citing you for gross misconduct! You are hereby summoned to appear before the board of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp looks enraged. He grits his teeth. He reach into his back pocket and withdraws a similar pad labelled Boating Violations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm writing you up back! Be notified that you stand accused of the mistreatment and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks. Redford is standing on a pew with his arm stretched out pointing up at the choir loft in amazement. troop is there, but Sam's and Suzy's seats are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a flash, a bang, and all the lights in the room out at once. People gasp. Candles flicker alight on candlesticks. A back-up generator kicks into gear, hummin and the room fills with a new, different light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp says to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy? 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gadge! Lazy-eye! Skotak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp strides down the aisle. He shouts up to Sko

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they go? Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skotak hesitates. He and the rest of the troop all look u a small, rickety, attic door. It is slightly ajar above a long, narrow ladder behind the pipes of the organ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp bolts up the steps. Everyone follows him, running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm rages. Captain Sharp opens a trap door onto the high eaves. Faces appear in numerous windows below, looki up. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop poke their heads out behind Capta Sharp. On the far end of the rooftop, Sam and Suzy huddle together at the base of the high steeple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp stares up at Sam and Suzy, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy quickly start climbing a rusty gutter up the side of the steeple. Captain Sharp looks astonished. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy continue to climb. Captain Sharp shouts back Mr. and Mrs. Bishop over the roaring wind:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward appears and thrusts out the coil of rop He yells to Captain Sharp:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Take this! 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp throws the rope over his shoulder and advan Mr. and Mrs. Bishop both crawl out after him, but Scout Master Ward pulls them back. Mr. Bishop looks to Mrs. Bis They are both terrified and helpless. They hold on to eac other tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp tight-rope-walking along the edge of the slippery roof with his arms stretched out sideways, balancing. He army-crawls up steep slate shingles and rea the bottom of the steeple. He looks up. Sam and Suzy have arrived at the top. They inch away sideways around a ledg and disappear to the other side. Captain Sharp's voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? What are you doing? Come down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp rubs his eyes. He knots one end of the rope around his waist and ties the other to a pipe at the foot the gutter. He pulls the rope tight, presses his foot on wall, and gets ready to start climbing -- then stops suddenly. He hesitates. He pulls the walkie-talkie off hi belt and yells into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services? Do you read me? Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy at the top of the steeple standing with thei backs against a painted cross. They look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire church has become an island. The cemetery is u water, and the circling streets are fast rivers. Suzy tur to Sam. They both appear relatively calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might have to swim for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep is it? I didn't bring my life jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but if it's too shallow, we'll break our necks, anyway. Hang onto me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy link arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp climbing the steeple as Social Services yel at him over the speaker of his walkie-talkie:

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL SERVICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Application denied! I'm sorry! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counsellors? What's the legal perspective? Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Bishop watching from the trap door with Scou Master Ward. Mr. Bishop's eyes widen. He turns quickly to Mrs. Bishop. She nods, energized. Mr. Bishop grabs Scout Master Ward's walkie-talkie and shouts forcefully:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP
dialogues.text: In this state? I would litigate with extreme confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I concur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open with article fifteen of the Codes of Civic Jurisdiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No party, under any circumstance, shall be denied due and proper consideration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services' face, inscrutable, as she listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy preparing to jump. They each take a deep bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On three again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Just in case this is a suicide, or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they capture us, and we never see each other again anymore -- thank you for marrying me. I'm glad I got to know you, Suzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy looks deeply moved. She kisses Sam. A little electri zap crackles at their lips. Suzy's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you've still got lightning in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy look down at the water again. Captain Sharp' voice screams from off-screen:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN SHARP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy recoil. Captain Sharp appears, clinging to t corner of the ledge. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Suzy retreat slightly. Captain Sharps waves his h in surrender. He yells into the walkie-talkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp holds out the walkie-talkie. Social Service voice comes over the scratchy speaker once more. She shou

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL SERVICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain Sharp is offering to assume the responsibility of foster parenthood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward watching from the trap door with Mr. an Mrs. Bishop. He says excitedly into his walkie-talkie:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: He wants you to live with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social Services watching from an attic window. She says softly into her own walkie-talkie: 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this acceptable to you, Mr. Shakusky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam staring at Captain Sharp. Captain Sharp says hopefull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Sam's cheeks in the rain. He looks to S She nods. She holds Sam's hand, and Sam reaches out to ta Captain Sharp's. Captain Sharp says into the walkie-talki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming down! Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the church. The congregation listens on another wa talkie. They are all just about to burst into a cheer -- there is a second, brighter flash followed by a much loud bang and then a terrible, thunderous, ripping explosion. lights go out again. Everyone screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward, Mr. and Mrs. Bishop, and Social Servic stare with their mouths open in frozen horror. The entire steeple has disappeared. Only a twisted stump remains. Of the edge of the roof, at the end of the rope, dangling in rain, Captain Sharp hangs swinging with Sam's hand in his fist and Suzy's in Sam's. Voices shout in a panic above. and Suzy look up at Captain Sharp. He says to them evenly swaying above the rushing water:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days later. The detached steeple of the church lies its side on the roof of a smashed Volkswagen. The ground covered with strewn branches and trash. Sandbags still surround the building. The narrator stands in front of th wreckage and addresses the camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Beacon storm was considered by the U.S. Department of Inclement Weather to be the region's most destructive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: meteorological event of the second half of the twentieth century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A basketball backboard sticks up out of nine feet of stan water. The net grazes the surface. The narrator sits in a rowboat floating alongside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lingered through six high-tides and inundated the islands with punishing winds and extreme high waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous neon ace-of-spades with the word Open spelled broken light-bulbs above it is jammed sideways into a san beach. Brightly painted wooden planks are littered everywhere. The black lighthouse remains intact in the background. The narrator, now tiny in the frame, continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On St. Jack Wood, powerful surges broke the arcade boardwalk and demolished the village bandstand and casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One week later. A repaired Camp Ivanhoe sign is being hoi up into place above the entrance. Scouts throughout the c hammer, chop, nail, and saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward's portable night stand. The reel-to-ree tape recorder is recording. The photograph of the Scout Master-in-Chief at the Matterhorn has been replaced by a picture of Becky operating her switchboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward says into the microphone:

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Scout Master's log. October tenth. Reconstruction continues increasingly ahead of schedule, which I attribute to a particularly robust esprit de corps among the troop. The latrine, however, continues to present --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward notices Skotak and a young boy with gla standing in the doorway. He says, off-mic: 103.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: Is this the new recruit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT MASTER WARD
dialogues.text: What's his rank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pigeon Scout! Let's get you a patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout Master Ward presses stop on his tape recorder and l Skotak and the young boy out of the tent. The narrator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coastal areas of New Penzance were battered and changed forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrator's nautical chart. The cove is no longer identified.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet was erased from the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One year later. The sky is blue. Wildflowers grow in the grass. The narrator, now in shirtsleeves, concludes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But harvest yields the following autumn far exceeded any previously recorded, and the quality of the crops was said to be extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrator lingers for a moment, looking into the camer then turns away and walks down the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing at the top of the staircase. The portable rec player sits on the braided rug with the turntable spinnin child's voice says over the speaker: 104.

dialogues.speaker: RECORD PLAYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So you see, the composer Benjamin Britten has taken the whole orchestra apart. Now he puts it back together again in a fugue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel, Murray, and Rudy lie on the floor on their stomac propped up with their chins on their fists. They listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy sits in a small armchair reading a book called The Return of Auntie Lorraine. There is an illustration on th cover of a leathery, old woman and a girl with a pony-tai looking together into a crystal ball. The kitten scratche Suzy's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits on a stool painting a picture at the small easel wears a miniature version of Captain Sharp's short-sleeve uniform with a black necktie and a baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bishop's amplified voice booms from the bottom of th

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BISHOP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Suzy? Lionel, Murray, Rudy! Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts. Lionel, Murray, and Rudy look up from the rec player. Suzy is impassive. Mr. Bishop's voice takes over

dialogues.speaker: MR. BISHOP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't make us ask twice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel, Murray, and Rudy jump to their feet and race down stairs. Sam dashes to the window. He opens it, climbs out and disappears. Suzy closes her book and rises to her fee Sam's head pokes back up from below. He and Suzy lock eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiles. He whispers to Suzy urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy smiles back. Sam ducks away. Suzy goes over to the window and looks out with her binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A binocular shot of Sam dropping to the ground and runnin across the back lawn, into the trees. He comes out on the dirt road where Captain Sharp waits, sitting on the hood his station wagon, smoking a cigarette. They both get int the car and drive off. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy lowers the binoculars. She pauses in front of the ea and looks at the picture. She walks quietly away down the stairs. The kitten follows her. The record continues to p on the empty landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves in toward Sam's painting on the easel. I a watercolor landscape of Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet. The tent pitched on the beach, and Sam's and Suzy's clothes hang o the clothesline. Written in the sand with seashells just the water's edge are the words:
